node.title: Rita Ora signs record deal that lets her own her masters
node.description: Rita Ora has signed a global recording deal with BMG that gives her ownership of all future master recordings.

node.title: Investors can expect some healthy returns despite 'muted outlook'
node.description: Investment funds are expected to deliver good returns over the coming year, despite rising inflation and interest rates.

node.title: Buller District mayor announces Westport evacuations as more heavy rainfall expected to hit
node.description: Civil Defence has ordered a partial compulsory evacuation of Westport after days of rain and more heavy falls expected tonight.

node.title: Gregory McMichael withdraws plea after judge blocks agreement
node.description: The trial for Gregory McMichael, who has already been convicted of killing the 25-year-old Black man in 2020, is scheduled to begin on Monday.

node.title: Mount Everest's highest glacier is losing decades' worth of ice every year, scientists warn
node.description: Climbing the highest mountain in the world could become more dangerous due to the lack of ice.

node.title: Covid-19: Community isolation scheme needs to be overhauled - study
node.description: New Zealand needs to overhaul its Covid-19 community isolation scheme and better fund GPs and primary healthcare workers on the front line, a new paper says.

node.title: RNC to consider resolution to censure Cheney and Kinzinger
node.description: The RNC's resolutions committee unanimously passed the resolution on Thursday afternoon, and the full RNC will vote on Friday.

node.title: U.S. maintains border policy of expelling migrants, citing Omicron
node.description: The CDC order allows U.S. border officials to expel migrants to Mexico or their home countries without allowing them to request asylum.

node.title: 'Massive barrier': Business needs more certainty around self isolation plans - Fyfe
node.description: The country needs to scrap several days in self isolation for fully vaccinated arrivals by the middle of the year, government business adviser on Covid-19 Rob Fyfe says. Audio

node.title: Jane Campion's Power of the Dog gets 8 BAFTA nominations
node.description: New Zealand director Jane Campion's western The Power of the Dog has eight nominations for the British Academy Film Awards.

node.title: 'Self-isolation won't be something that we ask people to do forever' - Hipkins
node.description: There could be significant rates of Covid-19 in the community once overseas New Zealanders can self-isolate at the end of the month, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says. Audio

node.title: 'Compassion fatigued' - NZ healthcare worker says border restrictions broke her
node.description: When Sinead Aldrich left New Zealand for London and her great OE in 2019, she never guessed just how profound that experience would be. Audio

node.title: China 'not suited' to hosting Winter Olympics
node.description: British freestyle skier Gus Kenworthy says China is "not well suited" to host the Winter Olympics because of its human rights abuses.

node.title: South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem bans transgender athletes from female sports teams
node.description: Opponents of the legislation condemned its passage Thursday, calling it "discrimination."

node.title: Whānau dispute coroner's findings over forest worker's mistakes
node.description: The brother of an East Coast forester killed on the job says he gave up a fishing trip to keep felling trees because he knew crews were relying on him.

node.title: "There are a lot of dark times": Care boxes help cancer patients cope with chemo
node.description: The care boxes include remedies to help with nausea and other discomforts experienced during chemotherapy.

node.title: A shelter is going beyond basic needs, giving homeless people job training
node.description: "We do believe once we settle your basic needs we need to give you more," Chapman Partnership CEO Symeria Hudson said.

node.title: Alabama tornado leaves 1 dead and 8 injured, local official says
node.description: Hale County Emergency Management director Russell Weeden confirmed three people are in critical condition and five have minor injuries.

node.title: Leading gymnastics coach Peddy Liddick sanctioned for harassment of Olympic athlete
node.description: The Gymnastics Australia Hall of Fame member is sanctioned but not stood down after a tribunal found some claims of harassment from gymnasts to be true.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (February 6)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: 'It means the world': Bar owner ecstatic over border reopening plan
node.description: Tourism operators are keen to roll out the welcome mat for international visitors but say the current isolation rules will keep many away.

node.title: How realistic are Auckland's light rail plans?
node.description: The Detail - At last a concrete plan for light rail in Auckland - but at an eye watering cost. What are the chances of this really happening? And is it the right option?

node.title: Government plan to protect gay students while allowing greater religious freedoms in disarray
node.description: The federal government's plan to protect religious freedoms while also stopping schools from banning gay students and teachers is in disarray, with internal disagreement about the details and the process for changing the law.

node.title: Minister steps in to change Kāinga Ora complaints process for unruly tenants
node.description: State house tenants who terrorise their neighbours can now be moved on faster after Kāinga Ora changed its complaints process.

node.title: Breast cancer outcomes worse for Māori, Pacific women, new study finds
node.description: The chances of women dying from breast cancer have halved since 2003, but Māori and Pacific women still face higher risk, particularly within 10 years of getting the disease.

node.title: Mental health takes its toll on Phoenix midfielder
node.description: Phoenix midfielder Grace Wisnewski will miss their A-League women's game against Melbourne Victory tonight due to mental health issues.

node.title: Amazon hikes annual price of Prime membership
node.description: Higher transportation costs and wages are behind the its first Prime price hike in nearly four years, Amazon said.

node.title: Why a Kiwi journalist's treatment by Taliban has shocked Afghan women
node.description: Afghan women accuse the Taliban of using a pregnant, New Zealand journalist as a publicity tool to show the world they can offer women rights.

node.title: Islamic State leader Abu Ibrahim al-Qurayshi killed in Syria, US says
node.description: A US special forces raid in north-west Syria killed the leader of the Islamic State jihadist group, President Joe Biden says.

node.title: Same-sex penguin couple welcomes chick at New York zoo
node.description: The two male penguins named Elmer and Lima took turns incubating the egg — and the zoo says their chick is thriving.
